intro: Hieracium insignitum, commonly known as the showy hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and meadows, preferring well-drained soils. Its yellow flowers are surrounded by a ring of pale yellow to white ray florets, and it produces numerous small, oval seeds. Hieracium insignitum is often found in disturbed habitats and can be invasive in certain regions.
